"And last, but not least, the one who's made all of this possible! Without you, I wouldn't have achieved my dream of eating everything at the fair." She gestured to the bare fairgrounds. "Every single morsel and animal are now in my stomach. Even the rides have found a new home!" She grinned. "And it's all because of you."
Templeton paused. "So, can I go now?"
"Of course!" the smiling cat replied. "In my stomach, that is." And with that, Templeton was thrown into the dark abyss of no return.

The cat smiled. Her monster of a stomach handled everything the fair has to offer, from the food to the animals to the rides. And to think that just a couple of hours ago, she was smaller than the average cat! Now, there was nobody to challenge her size or girth.

The cat's stomach rumbled. Even after all of the food, her stomach still wanted more. She began to think about what to do. She knew about another fair a couple of blocks away even bigger than this one. But she kept her mind open for other ideas. Looking around, she made a decision.
13322121111.title: Fatten her to immobility, if it ever happens.

choices: Inside the belly of the beast.
133221211112.content: Should she get food from somewhere else or shall we go inside the belly of the beast to see what has become of Templeton? (It is his story, anyway.)
133221211112.title: Other choices.

1332212111121.content:
The cat's stomach growled and her mouth smiled. This wasn't even a question. Of course she would want to eat more! She wanted to eat more and more and more until the universe was depleted of edible objects! Then she'd make sure that alternate universes existed so that she could go to them and repeat the process. But for now, choosing her next gorging spot was more important.
She looked out into the distance, her beast of a belly making her look taller. She giggled as her belly wobbled and shook. No doubt it's inhabitants were looking for a way to escape. She spotted the fair a couple of blocks away, as she expected. But on her other side, just as close, was a small town. Normally, she would've gone straight for the fair. However, the small town was clearly a town that was big on food. He figured that there would be just as much food in either place. But which would she go to first?
1332212111121.title: Some eating spree.

13322121112.content:
Templeton couldn't think of anything to do. The cat was putting obscene amounts of food in the blink of the eye, so Templeton wasn't sure if she could be immobilized, and that was his only idea. He decided to just feed her and plan while he did it.
Suddenly, he heard the cat yell, "Hurry up! Get me food faster!" Templeton quickened his pace. Every pile he made was bigger than the previous one. For each pile he made, he continued to ponder upon what to do. Meanwhile, the cat was in ecstasy. She had a servant forced to give her endless amounts of food! It really didn't get better than that. It especially helps if you can make a meal out of your servant when he's done with his labor, which of course was her eventual plan. After all, he had to pay in some way for trying to trap her. The cat decided that a trip down her gullet was enough punishment. Plus, it would nourish her dangerously obese body even more. It was a win-win situation for her. She smiled and continued to gorge, her stomach grumbling in hunger.
After half an hour, Templeton saw a building with lots of food inside of it. He couldn't tell what it was for a second until it hit him. The kitchen! He could leave her in there! There was certainly plenty of food in there. Perhaps he could ditch her in there and just gorge on the rest of the food in the fair. Templeton missed the feeling of having a big belly. He looked down at his petite stomach. "Don't worry," he said. "I'll get you food soon enough." He worked even faster, trying to ignore the loud chewing of the cat behind him. It reminded him of his fate if his plan failed in any way. After 5 minutes, he made it to the kitchen. Walking into the kitchen, the cat followed him. He looked around. There was certainly tons of food there. "This should keep her busy for a while," Templeton thought. However, it looked like she would have some competition. A plump canine was already here, along with a few rats. Templeton secretly felt sorry for them, given their eventual fate. Looking behind him, Templeton's jaw dropped. The cat simply looked too big to exist. Her belly took up the entire doorframe by itself. He heard the cat yell, "Pull me in!" Templeton grabbed some of her soft fat and pulled. The animals watched this spectacle as the largest mammal they had ever seen attempted to get it. Their food remained forgotten in the scene of it all. After a minute of struggling, the cat managed to get in and began to gorge. She was glad that the rat found such a great gorging spot for her. Immediately she spotted one of the rats. Without a second thought, she snatched the rat and gulped him down, which was the fate of every animal, big or small, that crossed her path. Of course, the only exception was Templeton, but she was going to eat him anyway after he finished his work. She looked at the other rats and the dog huddled in the corner. "Which one of you is next?" she asked. Eyeing the dog, she licked her lips and picked him up. "I guess I'll have the one with the most meat first," she said. Laughing evilly, she threw him into her mouth, soon to be another life lost to the gluttony of the feline. In the midst of it all, Templeton scampered out and closed the door quietly.
13322121112.title: Feed now, plan later.

choices: There may be hope. Keep on giving her food.
There's no chance. Give up. Let yourself add to her waistline.
1332212112.content:
The cat was in heaven. She had a servant who had to comply to her smallest whims and provided her with an endless amount of food. The rat was making endless piles of it for her, and she was loving it. Ever since she had come out of her dying mother's womb a month ago, she had always wanted to experience the feeling of filling her belly many times over, and now her dreams were finally coming true!
Moving on to the next pile, all of the food there quickly disappeared into her unsatisfied gut, which grumbled in protest. She wanted more! She wanted to eat until the world ran out of food! After that, she would have to start eating everyone she came across (which she kind of already did). But hopefully that wouldn't be for a while.
Meanwhile, Templeton was making a continuous line of piles of food for the lardball to consume, hoping that she would eventually eat herself to immobility.
An hour of laborious work later, Templeton came to a rest. He had made about 30 piles of food within the course of an hour. Templeton rested against the last pile he made and sighed. Hopefully this would be enough to satiate her appetite. He could hear the sound of chewing behind him. All of a sudden, he heard it very close. He looked behind and nearly screamed.
The cat's stomach, once globe-like and small (compared to now anyway), was now three times the size of one. Templeton noted that a family of canines could comfortably fit inside of it. Every inch of it wobbled and shook with every tiny movement she made. She was unable to walk properly. Her stomach deprived her of such a simple luxury. And the cat was proud of it. She loved every inch of her monstrous stomach. All she wanted was for it to be bigger. The obscene amounts of food could not sate her hunger. By no means had she eaten too much. She could eat the whole fair five times over if she wanted to! There was no stopping her gluttony. She had no limits. All she knew were her bottomless stomach, her never-ending hunger, and food. No matter how much she ate, as long as there was food, she would go to the food, no matter what it took.
Finishing up the second-to-last pile, she looked over at Templeton's appalled face. "Are you going to get me more food or what?"
Templeton was taken aback by this statement. "You're still hungry?"
The cat hissed. "Yes, and I will eat all that this fair has to offer. Whatever I say, goes. Now get me more food!" She began to attack the last pile.
Templeton sighed. At this point, despite being much slimmer, given the cat's girth, she could easily smother him, and if not, she could just grab him, so there was no use in running away. His original plan would no longer work thanks to her ability to somehow walk no matter how large her waistline was. He had no choice but to accept his fate until he could come up with a plan. But was it even worth serving the cat anymore? It didn't seem like there was an end to this madness.
1332212112.title: No such thing as too much!

choices: "I found something, but you have to follow me."
"Get it yourself you tub of lard."
13322121121.content:
"Okay. I will get you some more food." Templeton said not to o keen on getting her more food.
"Excellent!" The cat said grinning. "Now remember, if you don't keep it going...." She then open her mouth and pointed that that's where Templeton will go in if he doesn't get food.

Templeton then admittedly started running to get her more food. He found a couple more hotdogs, burgers, buckets of stale popcorn, and some corndogs. He would normally stuff himself with all this stuff, but he really wanted to live. He needed to come up with a plan.

"I need to think of something." Templeton said to himself. "I don't want to eat so much that nothing is left for me. That and she's most likely to eat me after I give her what she wants."

The thought of the massive kitty devouring him into that pit she calls a stomach gave Templeton the shivers.

"I have to avoid that at all cost." Templeton said.

Templeton then delivered more piles of food to the cat. She continued to eat and eat and eat. Not even resting or chewing her food. Her belly bloated up more and more. Her belly was now close to the size of a tracker. But she wanted it to grow even bigger.

"More. I want MORE." She said.
"Ye...yes." Templeton said shaking and then running off.

All the running has reduce most of Templeton's belly. He was still quite fatter than his normal self, but now more of a pear shape and had a big rump. He was starting to get unhappy and the feeling shows with his growling belly.

"Uhhhhh....I'm starving. But I need to get her all the food I can or else......" Templeton was in a bind. "Why did I get myself into this mess? What am I gonna do?"

Templeton then fell to the ground and weep for a bit, but then he looked at some machine.

"Huh? What's that?" Templeton said. He then walked over to the machine. It had some kind hose attached to some tank. Then a idea came to the fat rat's head. "It will be risky, but it might work."

So with the rat's plan in mind, he goes back to the behemoth bellied cat.

"You. How come you haven't brought me more food?" The cat said angry.

Templeton then said....
13322121121.title: There may be hope. Keep on giving her food.

choices: Machine time! It probably won't work, but oh well.
She's probably too big. Get her food first and think of plans while getting food
133221211211.content:
The kitten frowned. "And why should I follow you?" she asked.
"This area has no more food," answered Templeton. "There's another place that has much more food."
"But look at this stomach!" complained the calico, patting her obese wrecking ball of lard. "It'll take forever for me to get there!"
Now, to the casual observer, she may have had a fair argument. However, in reality, it wouldn't take her forever to get there, and the cat knew that. In fact, she could get there quickly if she wanted to. She was simply much too lazy to even lift her legs. Templeton didn't know this, and so thought she had a point.
Suddenly, the lazy kitten spotted twenty cats walking in their direction. They were clearly not here for the food, as they all seemed to have normal body weights, except for one. She looked at them and said in her cutest voice, "Excuse me?"
They stopped. Then a tabby cat in the front walked over to her. She could tell he was the leader. For one, he walked with as much of a strut as his dragging stomach would allow. He was also the only fat one of them all. The tabby then came over to the cat and asked, "Yes?" in a tone that suggested he was annoyed that she had bothered him.
"Can you do me a favor?" asked the calico. "Can you carry me to wherever the rat is going?"
"And where would that be?"
"Near the Ferris wheel," chimed Templeton, pointing to the grand structure about 50 feet away. "Not too far."
The gray cat scowled. "Why should we carry you when there is more food to be eaten, more places to gorge?"
"Pleeeease," begged the kitten. She stared at him with the most innocent look she could manage.
The tabby looked at her and sighed. "Fine." He called his friends (more like slaves, considering how much more fed he was compared to the rest of them) over. "Help me out with this." The other cats immediately sprang up and rushed over to her. They all gathered around her, with the exception of the tabby, who was munching on a hamburger he found on the floor. "On the count of three!" the leader yelled. "One, two, three!" The calico felt her body lifting ever so slightly above the ground. Templeton ushered them over to the Ferris wheel. As she was hoisted up, she asked, "What about my food? I want some food on the way."
"I'll get you food as we walk over there," replied Templeton, throwing her a whole watermelon. The cat replied by swallowing the watermelon whole. During the long, tedious, five minute journey, Templeton gave her food he found on the side. By the time they got there, the calico had devoured enough food to fill all of the cats carrying her 3 times over.
"Stop!" yelled Templeton in front of a huge pile of food next to the Ferris wheel. They didn't need telling. The cats immediately let her down and fell onto the floor, exhausted. The calico then observed her surroundings. The rat was right. There was much more food here than there was back there. She began to eat the food in front of her.
A minute later, the leader walked up to the kitten, who was finishing off the pile of food. "Now that I've brought you here, what shall I get in reward?"
She cocked her head. "What do you mean?"
"I meant that I helped you get your fat, lazy, overlarge butt over here!" he yelled. "You're telling me I deserve nothing?"
How rude! The kitten was appalled that someone could be so inconsiderate. He needed to be taught a lesson. She began to concoct a plan.
He continued. "Do you know how much food we could've eaten in the time it took you to get here?"
"You mean how much you could've eaten," she muttered.
"Excuse me?" the tabby roared. He stared at her with disgust. "You are a very rude and fat kitten. Look at you! My God, my entire family could live comfortably inside of your stomach. I demand a reward for having carried such enormous weight."
The kitten had enough. His attitude was too much. There was only one option left for him, and he wholly deserved it. She smiled evilly as she licked her chops. "How about a new home?"
"A home?" he asked. "Where?"
"Oh, it's very close to where you're currently standing."
"But where? Show me."
"I will." And with that, the obese feline picked up the flailing tabby.
"What are you doing?" he demanded, flailing in her hand.
"Oh, I'm eating you," the kitten said casually, is if he had just asked how the weather was.
"This is unacceptable!" yelled the tabby. "Put me down now! I have a lawyer you know! He'll hear about this!
"Oh, shut up," she yawned. She then threw him into her bottomless pit (or, as she liked to call it, her stomach), soon to be another victim of the calico's unsatiable gluttony. She looked at the other wide-eyed cats, staring in disbelief at the kitten's even larger belly.
"She ate master," one of them whispered.
The kitten smiled. She wouldn't mind having to eat all of them if they rebelled. Then there was suddenly a joyous cheering as they praised her for getting rid of their oppressive master. One orange cat came up to her with a picnic blanket filled with food. "We offer our thanks to you for freeing us from him. You shall be rewarded for this. What would you like? We can get you anything."
The kitten smiled as she began to eat the food. "Bring me all the food you can find!"
"Of course," the cat replied. "As you wish." He and the other eighteen cats went off for food. She then turned her attention to Templeton. "That includes you too, you know. Get me more food!"
Templeton scurried off. Suddenly, he remembered why he really brought the behemoth-bellied kitten here. But would the plan still work? He glanced at the machine he had seen earlier. She was likely much too big for it. Was it worth a shot? Or should he just keep finding food and think of a new plan? Risks, risks...
133221211211.title: "I found something, but you have to follow ...

133221211212.content:
"Wha....what did you say?" The cat asked looking angry.
"I said get it yourself." Templeton said. "I'm done getting food for you. You overbloated kitty."
"HOW...HOW DARE YOU!!!!" Shouted the cat in angry. "Do you WANT me to eat you here and now?"
"Quick question." Templeton asked. "Were you REALLY gonna let me go after I gave you all the food, or were you just gonna eat me when I was not needed anymore."

The cat was silent for a second. But there was no point in lying anymore.

"Hehe! Guess you aren't as dumb as you look." The cat said. "Yes. I would have eat you anyway. A plump rat like you looks beyond tasty. But not just that. My hunger is endless, so I would have gone and eat even more foods and get bigger and bigger. Beyond the limit. Maybe eat others animals too. Even my our kind."
"You take it a little too far for most gluttons." Templeton said. "You're crazy."
"Maybe. But I got to eat." The cat said. "Speaking of eating, since you won't get me food...."

The cat started to lick her lips and stares at Templeton. Templeton then starts to run.

"You will have to catch me first." Templeton said.
"Get back here!" The cat said ru...uh...waddling after him.

Due to all the running and not eating, Templeton was much faster than the cat. So he ran to the a part of fair to hide. Getting ready to try his plan on the cat. The cat was waddling around the area looking for Templeton.

"Where are you ratty? Come on out." The cat said. "The inside of my belly isn't so bad. Hahahaha!"

While she look for Templeton, she happened to see an uneaten hamburger on the ground.

"Huh. Looks like the rat missed something." The cat said. "I'll eat it later. I got to find that rat."

She was about to go back to her search, but then something seemed to pull her back. She couldn't just leave the burger there and she did say she wanted to eat every scrap of food here. So....
133221211212.title: "Get it yourself you tub of lard."

choices: It doesn't quite work. Maybe there's a way to make it work...
1332212112121.content:
6C
The cat sighed. The burger was too much to resist. Grabbing it, she threw it into her mouth. Then she looked in front of her. Right there was a literal mountain of discarded food over ten feet tall. Corn dogs, hamburgers, and other oily fast foods stood there for the taking. They seemed to be calling to her, "Eat us! We'd love to be in your belly!" Drooling, she dove in.
Five seconds later a slightly more bloated cat lay where the pile once stood. Next to her was a table with a considerable amount of food on it, including an enormous bucket of chicken. The feast could've easily fed a family of four for a month. Yanking the tablecloth, she swallowed the feast whole in two seconds flat, including the tablecloth and bucket. Then she spotted Templeton next to a machine. She grinned and rolled over there.
Templeton smiled as she came over. Finally, he would be free of his bondage, so long as he waited a little longer for the plan to work. He continued to grin even as his world became dark.
The cat grabbed Templeton. "Are you ready to be punished?" she asked, smiling.
Templeton faked a gulp. "Wait! Before you do, I want to make sure you get the food you want!" He pointed to the machine. "This machine sucks up all food in a set radius and shoots it out of this tube." He pointed to the hose-like object protruding from the tank.
The cat looked skeptical. "Show me."
Templeton pointed to the knob. "Set that to 10 feet and click the 'On' button." The cat looked around and saw twenty knocked-over trash cans nearby with some weasels trying to dig through its remains. She then did what Templeton told her to and pressed "On." Immediately a burst of the food in the garbage can came through the hose into the cat's open mouth and straight down to her stomach.
The cat's eyes widened with her even larger stomach. "Impressive," she said, licking her lips. "But why did I taste some weasel in the pile?"
"Oh, the machine identifies food as anything edible, so animals will be thrown into the bunch.
"So why weren't you thrown into the oblivion of my stomach?"
"It has a 2 foot dead zone. It also won't suck in the user of the machine, or anyone on the exception list, which can be configured here." However, Templeton had already added himself to the list before he came back to the cat.
She then set the dial to 50 feet and pressed "On". A torrent of food poured out of the hose. Screams could be heard as the load forced itself down the cat's throat and into her ever-expanding belly. In the midst of it all, Templeton slowly walked away. Suddenly, he felt something soft tighten around his body.
The cat lifted him up. "And where do you think you're going?"
Templeton gulped. "Can't I go now?"
The cat laughed mercilessly. "No. Your demise will only be delayed. After all, you haven't payed me back enough to allow me to spare your life. I'll simply eat you last. Meanwhile, I'll make sure you stay put." The cat then tucked Templeton right under her flabby bottom.
Templeton gasped for air as he heard the cat switch the dial. This was not how it was supposed to work. He was supposed to be out in the fair, gathering food before the cat could eat it. Instead, he was underneath the world's largest rump belonging to the world's most obese, crazy, merciless, lazy, and gluttonous cat. If only he could do something...
Meanwhile, the cat looked at the dial. From what it looked like, the maximum was 10 miles. She could grab all of the food in a ten mile radius. Amazing! She pressed the on button, and...
1332212112121.title: She eats the burger.

choices: Switch POV to Templeton inside the beast's enormous belly.
1332212112122.content:
The burger, though tempting, did not distract the feline. She needed to find the rat. She went right past it.
Meanwhile, Templeton was scared. How could she have not taken the bait? Now how would he escape? He watched as the cat searched for him, and his spirits lifted. Maybe, while she had her back turned, he could escape! Templeton saw an opportunity, and he dashed as quickly as he could. However, he was stopped by the even faster hand that grabbed him.
Templeton gawked at the multicolored lardball in front of him. "How did you get me so fast?" he asked.
The kitten smirked, looking pleased about herself. "I have my ways." She then stared at Templeton. "You know what will happen next, won't you?" Suddenly, the calico felt something gurgle in her throat. She burped as a rat's skull came out, no doubt the obese one she had swallowed earlier. Templeton gulped. The kitten sighed. "You could've been so much more. You could've lived longer, long enough to see me eat everything in the fair. Maybe I would have let you live long enough for me to eat everything on Earth!" She shook her head. "But now, here we are. You broke the rules, and now you will be punished." She then threw a screaming Templeton into her maw and felt her already overlarge stomach bloat slightly further. She sighed. "Now I have to find someone else to get food for me." Right on cue, a couple of rats came by. The obese kitten smiled. "Perfect." She snatched them as they yelled in horror. "Please don't eat us!" they shrieked.
The kitten smiled. "Oh, I won't, so long as you constantly bring me food. So go! Now!" With that, they scurried away.
1332212112122.title: Find the rat first.

choices: The cat continue to expand her waistline.
Templeton still climbed up her throat.
13322121121222.content:
Templeton slid the the throat of the cat down to the stomach screaming. He fell down onto a pile of food that haven been digested yet. Seemed like the kitty had a habit of shallowing and not chewing. Templeton got up and look around the large stomach. It was like being inside a room. A gross and slimy room.

"What a dilemma you got yourself into this time, Templeton." Templeton said to himself. "I should have never trusted that cat. Her appetite is so.....vorgul. She just wants to eat and eat. A true glutton, I admit. I envy her in that say. But she's going a little crazy. She said would want to eat everything in this whole planet if she would."

Templeton started thinking about his situation.

"My only concern now is to get out this monster's stomach." Templeton said to himself. He then observed some of the food the kitten has eaten. "Jeez. She just gulping food down so much that she doesn't gave her stomach a chance to digest. The amount of food she eats will decrese the amount it takes to digest it all. Which works for me."

He then looked up to the way he enter in.

"Better start climbing." Templeton said. But the moment he said that, more food came down to the stomach. Hot dogs, fries, as well as some other fair foods almost fell on Templeton. "What the......guess she's eating again."

Outside of the kitty's stomach, the cat was screaming "MORE! MORE FOOD! NOW!" The rats she was ordering around said "Yes ma'am." and ran to get her more food.

"Sounds like she got some more feeders." Templeton said hearing everything from the cat's stomach. "Either way, it's more of a reason for me to try to get out of her."

So Templeton started his climb. During the time.....
13322121121222.title: The belly of the beast.

choices: Find the throat! The cat will probably eat you anyway.
Maybe the cat wants to get out too. Finding her is probably better.
133221211212221.content:
The kitten smirked as the rats brought her more food. Their load of food was enough to feed an entire village. "Faster!" she yelled. "As fast as you can! I don't want my mouth to be empty again, or I'll eat you!" The rats sprinted away and came back a few seconds later with even larger piles of edible goodness, all for her to eat. The kitten began to shove the food into her mouth. Chicken, pies, burgers, even forks were swallowed by the beast, all in a vain attempt to sate her hunger.
Meanwhile, Templeton, trying to climb out, was suddenly crushed by a wave of food. He fell down, flailing. Grabbing onto a burger, he managed to surface his head, ready to try again, but the torrent kept coming. The stomach was already almost filled to the brim with food, and it just kept coming. Templeton swam far away from the throat to avoid being crushed again by the oncoming stream of food. Once he hit a stomach wall, he began to relax for a bit. Then realized he didn't know how to get back to the throat. He was lost. Lost inside of a stomach. It was so pathetic that it would've funny if the stomach didn't belong to a gluttonous kitten who never stopped eating. More food came as it filled the stomach, allowing his head to barely be seen. His head was touching the ceiling of the stomach. He swam over to the wall and leaned against it. Templeton could feel the ceiling and the wall moving, which he found quite odd. Then he realized that her stomach was expanding to make room for more food. Templeton shuddered at the thought of more food entering her enormous stomach. If more food meant a bigger stomach, that meant that he could get lost more easily and maybe never find a way out. He couldn't let that happen. He simply stood still and tried to think of a way out.
Meanwhile, the kitten was gorging on the never-ending supply of food being brought to her. The supply of food was twice as fast as before, given that there were now two rats giving her food. The pile in front of her was taller than her belly! She closed her eyes and sighed in bliss as she dropped an entire turkey down her maw. Opening her eyes, she suddenly noticed that some of her food was missing. The calico was furious. Who would dare to take her food? She reached blindly behind the pile and got something. It was heavy too. Quite heavy. She pulled her paw out from behind the pile and realized the thing she caught was a Siamese cat, and a very fat one at that. The Siamese was the fattest cat the kitten had ever seen. Despite being quite bottom-heavy, her stomach was still over two times larger than the calico's. The kitten snarled. She couldn't have competition, much less competition larger than her! There was only room for one obese, spoiled cat! Only one thing could be done to fix that.
The Siamese whimpered. Though she was fatter than the calico and could probably flatten her (which said quite something about her girth), the kitten had an iron grip. She knew there was no way to force herself out, so she decided to talk her way out of it.
The Siamese made a brave attempt at a smile. "H-hi."
"Hello," replied the calico casually. "How's life?"
"I-it's fine," answered the Siamese.
"That's nice," said the kitten. "You look quite plump."
"Th-thanks," the Siamese muttered.
"Plumper than me!" the hungry beast continued. "I've never seen anyone as fat as you before. It's bad when animals are fatter than me. I can't stand seeing someone larger." She licked her lips in anticipation. "Do you know what I do with them?"
"Share your food with them?" asked the Siamese hopefully.
"Eat them." The calico stepped back, preparing for the biggest thing she'd ever eat. She began to swallow the Siamese starting from her enormous rump. It took a bit of effort to swallow her whole, but after her prodigious belly, the rest of her furry body slid down easily. The Siamese fell down and was immediately buried by the incredible amounts of food in the stomach. Lacking the mobility of the calico, the Siamese couldn't get up from the pile of food. Already she felt the digestive acids working on her belly. She snarled. No! She wouldn't give up! She worked all five years of her life to get this fat! No way she was going to let a baby like the calico end her fun. She began to plan a way to get out.
Meanwhile, the kitten's stomach, already the size of a large room, tripled in size to the size of a house. Her eyes widened. She hadn't expected her stomach to become that large. Her shock quickly turned to joy as smacked her stomach and called into it, "Who's the fattest cat now?" She smirked and continued to attack the new, much larger pile of food in front of her brought by the rats in the midst of the encounter.
Inside the stomach, Templeton has no clue what was going on. One second, he was neck-deep in food near a stomach wall. The next second, he was being squished by both the top of the stomach and a huge, white belly of fur. He looked around. The stomach walls were gone. Probably much farther away to accommodate for the girth of the cat she had swallowed. Nothing familiar was in sight. Templeton sighed. He needed to get out. Maybe he could find the throat and see if she'd stopped eating, but she almost never did, so it was risky. Or maybe he could ask the cat in the stomach for help? Templeton shuddered. That was just as scary. What if the cat ate him the second she saw him? Was it worth the risk for the small chance of getting out? He could only think of these two plans, and both of them seemed unlikely to work, but it was worth a shot. Weighing his options, he decided to...
133221211212221.title: The cat continue to expand her waistline.

choices: Looks like the cat is the only option. Let's talk to her.
1332212112122211.content:
Templeton grimaced. The cat in the stomach probably wouldn't help him. He'd have to do it himself. Finding the throat, he watched as food constantly went down her throat and into her stomach. It seemed like a never-ending flow of edible goodness.
Suddenly, it hit him. Edible. He could eat the food in the stomach! He grabbed a burger and stuffed it down his throat. Grabbing a bucket of French fries, he poured them down his waiting maw. A bucket of chicken wings followed. He started on a tub of ice cream, but suddenly stopped halfway through. He looked at his body, already a little plumper than before. How would he ever get out if he ate a lot? What if he, like the Siamese in the stomach, became too fat to fit through the throat to get out? He stopped eating and looked at his stomach, which was already the size of a grapefruit. He sighed as he realized that it was weighing him down, which would make it harder to climb out. He had priorities, and priority #1 was getting out. Gorging would have to wait. Looking below him, Templeton also noted the Siamese cat eating everything around her. She was fatter than he had last seen the kitten, though obviously the kitten was much fatter now. Realizing how close he was to her, he noticed that he was fat enough to be considered a decent amount of food by the cat. He looked at her overlarge rump and decided he would not want to be part of it later on. However, he already ruled out climbing out of he throat by himself. Maybe he needed help. Just as long as he didn't eventually become part of another fat cat's belly.
1332212112122211.title: Find the throat! The cat will probably eat you ...

13322121121222111.content:
Templeton couldn't believe he was free. Finally he could glut. That stupid fat kitten couldn't stop him from glutting as much as he wanted to. He was about to dive into a garbage can when he heard shaking behind him and turned around. The building seemed to be struggling to stay together. Suddenly, the bricks went flying as the obese calico inside was freed from the building. Much larger than the building itself, her stomach wobbled as it was freed. She grabbed Templeton. "Did you really think that would work?"
Templeton gulped, thinking fast. "I was, uhh, getting you some more food! Yeah. I knew you'd finish quickly so I was gathering food from that garbage can." Satisfied, the kitten put him down. "Go get me more food!" she yelled. Templeton scampered away to get more food for the glutton.
13322121121222111.title: Looks like the cat is the only option. Let'...

choices: Her belly was still in pain, caused by the Siamese cat inside her.
Was too focus on finding more food.
1332212112122212.content:
Templeton took a minute to think about everything in his situation.

"Okay Templeton. Now think." Templeton said to himself. "The not so bitty kitty is eaten nearly everything in site. Including her own kind. She also seems to keep stuff her face every second she get the chance. Not only that, it seems like she has...some unusual stomach. If it get almost filled to the brim, it just expands to have more room. Which means, she can never be truly full."

The idea of that gave Templeton quite a surprise.

"It's no wonder she can eat so much." Templeton said to himself. "If I want to get out, I will have to stay active and keep moving."

He then walked in the stomach until he saw the large Siamese cat that gotten eaten. It seem risky, but he had to try something. So he asked her for help.

"So...she ate you too?" Templeton said to the Siamese cat.
"A...rat?" The Siamese said. "What do YOU want?"
"Guess you are a bit touchy from being eaten." Templeton said. "Look. I just wanted to ask for your help. Usually I would avoid cats as big as you, but I'm running out of options."
"Usually, I would eat a plump rat like you." The Siamese said.
"I was plumper. I had a belly bigger than a watermelon. But giving food to that greedy kitten caused me to slim down a bit. You looked bigger then she is. Well...was. Now that she's eaten you....."
"What do you want okay?"
"Help. Don't you want to get out of here?"
"Well this isn't really a place I want to be in."

Templeton looked up and sawed a couple of food dropping down.

"That's got to be where the throat is." Templeton thought. "Hey, I have an idea."
"What's your idea?" The Siamese asked.
"Over there is our way out." Templeton said pointing at the dropping food. "If you could make a ruckus, cause her discomfort for a bit so she can't focus on eating, I could get out from her mouth. Like a furball she has to hack off."
"Cause a ruckus? After eating me, I'll do more than that."

The Siamese then started bouncing and punching the stomach walls. The Calico started to feeling rumbling in her stomach. She just shallowed a whole bucket of chicken and was around the size of a house.

"Huh?" The kitten said noticing the stomach rumbling. "Looks like the big old cat still has some fight in her." The kitten smirked devilishly. "Fool. Do you really want to fi....."

Then the kitten stomach was starting to feel more pain.

"DAHH!!!!!! Grrrrrr......persistent are you? I can't focus on eating." The kitten said.

With her distracted from eating, now was Templeton chance to star climbing. It took a while, but he made it to the throat hole. Before he climbed up it, the Siamese spoke out.

"Wait!" The Siamese said.
"What?" Templeton said.
"Listen, you may be able to still get out, but with my size, I'm pretty stuck here." The Siamese admitted. "Can you do me a favor?"
"I don't like doing favors, but what is it?"
"When you get out, find some way to stop that glutton of a kitten."
"I don't even think that's possible now. The only thing I cared about was stuffing my face. Now I only care about living and avoid getting eaten again. But if there is some way to stop her from eating everyone and everything, then I may do it."
"That will do then."

With that said, Templeton continue to climb while the Siamese continue to cause a ruckus in the kitty's belly. When Templeton finally made it to the throat of her mouth. The calico felt like a hairball was in her throat. She then hack out Templeton. The rat was free again. which the kitty was not to happy.

"YOU?!?!? BUT I ATE YOU." The kitten said.
"And now I'm out." Templeton said.
"I don't know how you got out.....BUT YOU ARE GOING BACK IN."
"If you can catch me." Templeton said smirking.

Templeton quickly ran away from the kitty. At her current state, moving wasn't really that possible. But with some of the steps she could take, the ground shook. Templeton still move quickly and while the kitten tried to move....
1332212112122212.title: Maybe the cat wants to get out too. Finding her...

choices: Eat now and be eaten soon! Better than serving the cat and being eaten later.
Just get her the food. Maybe there's a way out.
13322121121222121.content:
New Note
The calico was furious. How did that rat escape? She couldn't believe she let it happen. And it was all because of the Siamese cat in her stomach, who was still causing a ruckus in there. Her stomach hurt a lot. She yelled, "Hey! Stop that right now!" Ignoring her, the Siamese continued to kick and punch the kitten. Howling in pain, she punched her stomach, hoping to hit her visitor. She smiled as she heard her fist connect to one of the Siamese's legs. It was the Siamese's turn to scream in pain as she stopped kicking the stomach due to her newly broken leg. The kitten was truly proud of her strength. She could really pack a punch if she wanted to.
The calico called into her stomach, "Would you like me to break your other legs? Because I will if you don't stop punching." She was answered by silence. "Good cat," she purred. "Just wait as you slowly dissolve into nourishment for my body." The Siamese sighed. The digestive acids were really starting to work on her. She felt her whole stomach burning. Soon her fat would dissolve and turn into, well, fat. The kitten, oblivious to the pain of her visitor, grinned. "You should feel honored that you get to contribute to the body of the world's fattest cat!" With that said, she turned her attention to the food in front of her, brought by the other two rats in her service. She smiled. The pile was as large as her belly. The calico dug into her meal while considering possible locations of the rat.
She looked around and sniffed the air. She could smell something ratty nearby. Pausing her feast for a second, she grabbed a nearby garbage can and turned it upside-down. She caught the contents in her blubbery paw. Banana peels, moldy bread, and other junk fell into her hand. She extracted something out of the pile that didn't seem to belong. She grabbed a rat's tail and pulled it out. The kitten smiled as Templeton's shocked face stared right back at her.
He was stunned. How did she manage to find him? Maybe his fur was too exposed in an environment like that. Nevertheless, he gulped as he knew the next thing that would happen. And this time, it didn't look like there was a cat to save him, as the belly had stopped moving too much, signaling that the cat had been digested.
He closed his eyes, waiting for the inevitable. He waited. And waited. But nothing happened. He then realized he was on solid ground and staring up at the face of the monstrous kitty. She sighed. "You just don't learn, huh?" She resumed her rampage on the pile of food while talking to Templeton. "You had one job. That job was to give me food." She threw three turkeys into her mouth simultaneously. "But you didn't do it, so I had to eat you. Yet here you are again. I'll give you one last chance." She shoved five pies down her throat. "Get me food like the other two rats. Don't eat any of it. If you eat anything or complain, you know what your punishment will be." Suddenly, she felt something in her throat. She burped. A cat's skull popped out of her throat and landed in front of Templeton. The skull was no doubt the one of the cat she had just eaten. Templeton backed up in fear. "Whoops," said the kitten, giggling. Then she continued. "The longer you follow directions, the longer you delay the inevitable. So go! Get me food!" She continued to attack the pile.
Templeton didn't even know what to do. Sure, she would eat him no matter what. But maybe he could talk her out of this later. Or should he gorge now and risk being eaten? Templeton was craving food in his belly, but he knew that the second the food touched his lips, it would be goodbye for him. He thought for a while about what to do...
13322121121222121.title: Her belly was still in pain, caused by the Siam...

choices: Do the plan. It should work for now.
133221211212221212.content:
Temple was both scared and furious. If he ate even one thing, we would be eaten himself. He also knew that the cat would just eat her again at some point. So he needed to come up with some plan. But for now, he had to play the role as the cat's servent. While he grabbed some food, he got the chance to talk to those other rats. This was a good time to talk to them.

"Listen you two." Templeton said to the other rats. "Just so you know, at one point, she WILL eat us all."
"D...don't you think we know that." The male rat said. "But what can we do?"
"You were inside her." The female rat said. "Do you really want to risk getting back in there?"
"Of course not. I was only lucky to get out." Templeton said. "Without that cat that helped me, I may not get a second chance."

The three rats then finish gathering more food and put them together to make a huge pile for the cat.

"Listen. There isn't much food left." Templeton said to the rats. "Not only that, the sun will rise soon. When that happens, humans will be here."
"You don't...think she will to eat humans too, is she?" The female rat asked.
"It wouldn't surprise me if she did." Templeton said.
"That...monster." The male rat said.
"Feel like that's an understatement." Templeton said. "When I was inside her, I saw her stomach get filled to the brim. But then it just...expanded. So that means believe it or not, she can never get full."
"So...we would be force to feed her....FOREVER?" The female rat said.
"I'm pretty sure we would die before that. By starvation or digestion." Templeton said.

Hearing that, the two rats feared for their lives either more.

"We're gonna die either way." The male rat said shaking.
"Calm down. I'm pretty sure she can smell fear." Templeton said. "We're feed her for now. I'll come up with something later."

The rats brought the pile to the cat. With three rats, the work was tripled.

"Excellent work, you three." The cat said.

She then gobbled down the big pile. Shallowing most of the food whole. This didn't made Templeton happy.

"She's just shallowing the food." Templeton thought. "She's not even savoring it. I bet she doesn't even know half the food she has eaten the whole night."
"I still want more." Remember...I want EVERYTHING." The cat said.

The three went to get more food. Unfortunately, the pile of food was looking light. It was mainly cause everything else was already in her belly. This made two of the rats panic, while Templeton tried to say calm.

"Is...is this all the food?" The male rat said. "WAH! THIS IS ALL THE FOOD."
"Noooooo!!!!!! WE ARE GONNA DIE!!!!"
"Calm down." Templeton told them.
"How are you not scared?" The male rat said.
"Guess getting eaten once takes some of the fear out." Templeton said. "Otherwise, I would be like you."
"Easy for you to say. I don't think we will be as lucky as you. What are we gonna do?" The male rat said.

Templeton thought deep about things and came with a new plan. The plan was convincing her to leave. With the fact that morning was coming, humans would soon arrive. They had to hope she didn't want to be seen by them. That and the fact the fair still had one more day left. So there would be more food to have. If only she waits til nightfall.
133221211212221212.title: Find another way.

choices: The next morning, Templeton told Wilbur and Charlotte everything.
The next morning, Templeton triex to think of what to do.
1332212112122212121.content:
It was risky, but Templeton was willing to try the plan.

"Okay. Here is the plan." Templeton said to the two rats. "When you give her the last pile of food, convince her to leave the fair grounds until night fall. The last day of the fair will only mean more food. Knowing her, she can't miss the opportunity of getting more food."
"Okay. But what about you?" The female rat asked.
"I gonna stay here and warn my friends Wilbur and Charlotte." Templeton said.
"You gonna ditch us with that blob of a kitty?" The male rat said a little ticked.
"One of us needs to come up with a plan to stop her." Templeton said. "If we all stay with her, we won't be able to do anything."
"Guess.....you have a good point." The male rat said.
"Okay. You two deliver the food to her 'blubberness.' I need to go into hiding." Templeton said. "Just tell her I got eaten by some other cat."
"Alright." The female rat said. "Be sure to hide you scent. That's how she found you last time."
"Thanks for telling me that." Templeton said before running off. "Okay. One last thing, don't get eaten."
"Before you go off, mine telling us your name?" The female rat asked.
"Templeton. Your's?" Templeton asked.
"Rusty." The male rat said.
"Sherry." The female said.

With that said, Templeton left the other two rats. First things first, he had to hide his scent, then hide somewhere. Wilbur's pen was the best place he could think of. He rolled on some dirt, then he goes to Wilbur's pen to hide. He happening to wake up Wilbur.

"T..Templeton?" Wilbur said quietly acter waking up.
"Shhhhh...stay quiet." Templeton whispered. Templeton then hides under a haystack behind Wilbur.
"What are you..." Wilbur asked.
"Shhh....I'll explain later." Templeton said quietly.

So Wilbur stayed quiet. Meanwhile, the other two rats, Rusty and Sherry just gave the last pile food to the blobby calico kitten. Telling her about leaving for the next night.

"So, this is all you could find?" The calico said.
"Yes. The rest of the content is in your belly." Sherry said.
"Good work, but where is the other one?" The calico asked.
"He tried to make a run for it, but was eaten by another cat." Rusty said.
"That so?" The cat then chug the rest of the food in her gullet. "What a shame. He was actually quite useful to me. Now, what to do with you two?"

The calico cat grinned delivish at the two rats. The both stepped back and spoke out.

"Hang on. There is still one more day of the fair." Rusty said.
"Yeah. You will need us to get more food for you." Sherry said. "If there was this much food left here then, just think about how much will be here tonight?"

The cat realized that they were right. All that extra food could be more than she desired.

"Okay. I'll leave until nightfall." The cat said. "But you are both coming with me, and no funny business."
"Yes ma'am" Rusty and Sherry said.

So the cat began leaving the fair grounds making heavy pounds on the grounds. Wilbur noticed the ground shaking the same for Charlotte.

"What's with all the shaking?" Charlotte said.
"An earthquake?" Wilbur thought.
"I'll explain later. Now stay quiet." Templeton said.

Then they saw it. The huge calico kitten who went from being slightly chubby to the size of a mansion.

"What...on Earth...is that?" Charlotte said shocked with what she was seeing.
"Shhhhh...." Templeton said.

The cat then turn to the pig pens.

"Pig pens, huh?" The cat said. "Normally I would love to eat each and everyone of them....."

Hearing that made Wilbur shake.

"But, I have to leave. Can't have any human know I was here." The cat said. So, consider you all lucky."

The calico then moved more. Further and further to the forest and deep so sbe can hide from them. They were all safe. Templeton then hopped out of the hay.

"Okay. I think we are safe for now." Templeton said.
"Templeton! What was that huge thing?" Charlotte asked.
"What was that talk about wanting to eat me and the other pigs?" Wilbur asked frightened.
"I'll tell you two everything later." Templeton said. "Right now, I need some rest. Been up all night and for something that was gonna be the best night of my life, it was the worst night of my life. I just need two hours and I'll talk. Is that okay?"
"Fine. I guess we can understand." Wilbur said.

So Templeton went to Wilbur's crate to get some sleep. After all the stuff with the cat, he needed the rest.
1332212112122212121.title: Do the plan. It should work for now.

choices: Go Jenna! Help her win against the calico!
13322121121222121211.content:
Templeton woke up as the fair opened. He blinked a couple of times before sitting up. Looking over at Wilbur, he noticed that Wilbur seemed to be looking at something else in the pen. Getting a closer look, Templeton realized that Wilbur was talking to a very cute and fat Siamese kitten, who was sitting down on her enormous watermelon-sized buttocks. Though not nearly as fat as the calico, her belly was still largely distended, touching the floor despite the fact that she was sitting upright. Getting a closer look, Templeton realized that she was crying. Thick tears were coming out of her bright blue eyes, splashing onto her large white stomach. Wilbur had a look of pure terror on his face. He looked at Templeton. "Good morning," he said, his voice shaking. "Jenna here just explained who wanted to eat us and what she did."
The kitten sniffled as she hung her head. "That monster ate my mom. I don't even know how she did it. I was taking some food from a pile with her when I saw a paw snatch up my mother. I ran and hid under a table as I saw a calico cat half of my mom's size talk to her for a bit. The calico said that she couldn't stand it when animals were fatter than her. Then she lifted my mom up, put her above her mouth, and...and..." Jenna broke down as Templeton remembered what had happened. Sharp images of a very large Siamese cat being swallowed by the calico rushed through his brain. He felt some sort of emotion running through him as he struggled to recognize it. Then it hit him. Sympathy. It was strange, because before this night, he had never felt sympathy or kindness toward anyone. But now, Templeton felt very sympathetic for Jenna and the fate of her mother. Perhaps last night had some positive effects as well. He raised his hand and put it on her blubbery shoulder. "It's okay. I was swallowed by the calico as well, right before your mother was swallowed."
Jenna sniffled. "Really?"
"Yup," replied Templeton. "I managed to escape with your mom's help. If it wasn't for her, I wouldn't be here. She helped me escape. She was a hero."
Jenna looked at him with her watery eyes. "Thanks." Suddenly, Templeton spotted a person coming over with slops. Templeton's eyes widened. She couldn't be seen in here. "Quick!" he said to her. "In here!" He pointed to Wilbur's crate behind him as he jumped in. With difficulty, Jenna stood up, her large rear end making it hard to stand. She waddled to the crate as her stomach dragged along. First her head went in, followed by her stomach, which took up most of the room in the crate. She was about to get her hind legs inside when she was stopped by her wide mounds of fat. Jenna groaned as she struggled to get inside the crate. Wilbur gave her large butt a few shoves, but it was simply too big. He gave up as the man came with the food. He casually stood in front of the crate as the man put the slops in the trough and walked away.
Wilbur sighed with relief. "All clear," he said. The cat stepped out of the crate, massaging her sore rump, followed by Templeton. Jenna eyed Wilbur's breakfast with interest. She looked at him. "Do you mind if I have some?"
"Go ahead," he said. "Have the whole thing if you want it. I lost my appetite a long time ago." Before he could even finish his sentence, Jenna grabbed the whole trough and tipped it over as the contents spilled into her mouth. She put down the empty trough and belched. "Thanks," she said. "Food always makes me happier." Jenna walked over to the corner of the pigpen. She buried her belly in the haystack and yawned. "I'll be asleep for now. If I can also have your lunch, wake me up then. If not, wake me up for dinner." She closed her eyes and fell asleep.
Meanwhile, Templeton stared wide-eyed at her enormous belly that took up an eighth of the pigpen. He suddenly thought up of a plan. Since Jenna was an extremely gluttonous kitten, Templeton thought that if anyone can stop the calico, it was her. But maybe another plan would work better...
13322121121222121211.title: The hero?

133221211212221212111.content:
Templeton had decided. Jenna would be their key to defeating the calico. He began to think about how this would work.
At noon, Jenna felt someone shaking her shoulders. She rolled over and heard a scream from beneath her. She quickly rolled back and saw a very out-of-breath Templeton laying there. She grinned sheepishly. "Whoops. Sorry."
"It's fine," gasped Templeton. "The slop just came and Wilbur said you could have it."
"Yay!" she said, grinning. "But where's Wilbur?"
"Right outside. All the pigs were called down for the pig-judging contest, and Wilbur wants me to come." Templeton then crawled out of the pigpen. "We'll be back soon!"
"Okay then," Jenna replied. "See you!"
Templeton simply waved back as the crate was taken to the judges. He couldn't help but smile as he watched Jenna gulp down the entire trough in two seconds. Templeton yawned. The hot sun made him tired. He closed his eyes and fell asleep.
An hour later, he awoke to a loud thud. Templeton looked and saw that Wilbur had fainted on the stage. The crowd all seemed to be shocked. He found it rather amusing that everyone was making such a big fuss. Quietly, he crawled over to Wilbur and bit his tail hard. Everyone cheered as Wilbur jumped awake, and they cheered even louder as he was given the medal. Wilbur was then put into the crate where Templeton was and was carried over to the pigpen. As Wilbur was let out, Templeton jumped out and sprinted inside, but the cat wasn't there. Templeton began to panic. Where did Jenna go? Suddenly, he heard a voice say, "Psst. Templeton." Templeton whirled around and saw Jenna's head poking out from behind the pig pens, her blue eyes piercing his. "Hey," he said. "What's going on?"
Jenna looked a little nervous. "Ummmm, after I ate Wilbur's lunch, I kinda noticed that none of the other pigs had eaten their lunch, and then I saw that everyone was at the pig-judging contest, and I saw a lot of food lying around on the fair grounds, and – "
"I'm pretty sure I know what happened next," Templeton interrupted. "How big are you now?"
"Ummmmm..." Jenna fidgeted nervously with her paws. "There's a reason I didn't come back to the pigpen. Why don't you come look?" Templeton climbed out of the pigpen, looked behind the pigpens, and gasped. In front of him lay an enormous Siamese cat with a stomach wide enough to take up two pigpens. Her thick hind legs hovered above the ground, completely useless. Her blubbery tail hug limply, just as useless. Her rump was three times the size it had previously been. Jenna sheepishly grinned. "I did tell you there was a reason. I certainly can't fit in the pigpen. Hopefully the humans won't come here." She yawned. "Wake me up when it's nighttime. The calico and I have a deal to settle." With that said, Jenna dozed off.
Templeton made his way back into the pigpen, where Wilbur was napping, his medal hanging proudly in front of the pigpen. He realized that soon, they would have to go back to the farm, where they would never have to worry about the calico again. He couldn't believe it! Finally, it would all be over soon. But then he thought about Jenna, and what the calico had done to her mother. Templeton wasn't sure whether he wanted to stay to help out Jenna, or if he wanted to go back to the farm, where he could gorge on lots and lots food, thanks to the fact that he had gotten Charlotte's egg sac for Wilbur in exchange for first pick on all of the slops. What to do, what to do...
133221211212221212111.title: Go Jenna! Help her win against the calico!

choices: Stay to try to stop the calico.
13322121121222121212.content:
It was morning and Templeton finally work up after three hours. It was only suppose to be two, but her really slept in. The fair was filled with people. More than yesterday. Which meant more food. Templeton walked up to the fence to look.

"So much people here." Templeton said to himself. "Well, at least that calico kitten is not here. But she will be back by night fall. What to do?"

While Templeton was thinking, Wilbur spoke up.

"Umm.....Templeton?" Wilbur said. "You mind telling us what was that giant blob last night was?"
"You said that...you would tell us." Charlotte said a little faint.
"I'll give you a short version" Templeton said. "Last night while I was feasting, I ran into a small chubby calico kitten. He forced me to get her all the food in the fair."
"All the food?!?!?" Wilbur said shocked.
"Yes. She later ate me after I fail to do what she wanted." Templeton said.
"She...ate you?" Charlotte said surprised.
"I got out with the help of a big Siamese cat she ate. After I got out, she force me to get food for her again with two other rats. Once all the food was gone, she became the size of a mansion. I went to hiding while telling the other rats, Rusty and Sherry to convince her to leave and not come back tell tomorrow. Well, that's the not so short version of everything." Templeton said.

Wilbur and Charlotte were stunned. They wouldn't believe it if they didn't see it last night.

"That's....crazy to believe. But it had to be true." Charlotte said.
"The worst thing is that she doesn't seem to get full no matter what she eats." Templeton said.
"Wha....what?" Wilbur said shocked.
"I know. She's a bigger glutton then me." Templeton said. "The worst part is she's coming back at night."
"Well today is the last day of the fair." Wilbur said. "So we don't have to worry about her anymore."
"Yeah....." Templeton said.

Something inside Templeton was bothering him. He could just go back to the farm and leave the fair, not having to deal with the cat. But he would be leaving the rats and not helping them. Let alone the last words of the Siamese cat that help him out of the calico's stomach. What to do?
13322121121222121212.title: Need a plan.

choices: Sneak around and get some grub.
Find something to use on the calico.
133221211212221212122.content:
Templeton just didn't get it. He usually isn't the type to be a hero, doesn't care about others, or do things others tell him. But the last words from the Siamese cat that save him were still in his head. Not to mention the other two rats Rusty and Sherry.

"You guys. Go on without me. I'm staying here." Templeton said.
"What?" Wilbur and Charlotte said surprised.
"Templeton. If this is because we want to stay here and glut on all the fair food, it's not....." Wilbur said.
"That isn't why I'm staying." Templeton said. "That calico cat is out of control. Not only is her hunger endless, but she is willing to devour everything in her site. It's hard to believe it, but what if she does eat everything on this planet? What would stop her?"

The image of the calico becoming bigger than a mountain, bigger than a country, even big enough to cover a chunk of the whole world was just a....frightful thought.

"That's why...I have to stop. I...think I'm the only one who can." Templeton said.
"Wow Templeton." Charlotte said. "This is the first time...I hear you say something so noble. And her I thought you only care about yourself."
"Yeah, yeah. Well don't get use to it." Templeton said. "Besides, if that not-so-bitty kitty eats everything, then what am I suppose to eat?"
"Haha. That sounds like you alright." Wilbur said laughing. "Always thinking about your stomach."

Templeton then looked up and saw an egg sac.

"What's that over there?" Templeton asked.
"It's Charlotte's egg sac." Wilbur said. "She's gonna be a mother."
"Hoo rah for Charlotte." Templeton said with a hint of sarcasm. "Should we pop a bottle or something?"
"Charlotte's dying Templeton." Wilbur said sadly.

Templeton was then silent for a moment.

"Oh." Templeton said.
"She can't come with us, so we were hoping you can get the egg sac down for us." Wilbur asked.
"Okay." Templeton said.
"Now don't complain. We really need you to...." Before Wilbur could finish what he was about to say, he realized that Templeton already said okay. "Wait! Did you say okay?"
"Yes. I'll get Charlotte's egg sac down." Templeton said.
"Really? Without a fuss?" Wilbur said.
"At least that egg sac is one good thing." Templeton said.

With that said, Templeton climb to grab the egg sac. Before that, he took a look at Charlotte who was looking fainter than ever.

"How are you holding up, Char?" Templeton asked.
"Not...so well." Charlotte said faintly.
"Hold on just a bit longer. As long as you can." Templeton said.
"I'll....try." Charlotte said.

Templeton grabbed the egg sac and put it inside Wilbur's crate. Then he went back to Wilbur.

"There." Templeton said.
"Thank you Templeton." Wilbur said.
"You can thank me later." Templeton said. "First call on your slop if when we get back to farm. If...I'm not eaten by that calico."
"Deal." Wilbur said.
"Now, we still have time before nightfall." Templeton said.

Templeton decide to do one of two things. He could sneak around and get some food, even if it's day time or look around the fair to see if there is something he could use against the calico.
133221211212221212122.title: Stay to try to stop the calico.

choices: Eat up! She'll never know! She was probably staring at something else anyway.
Keep hiding, or maybe even go back to serving her. Better eaten later than now.
13322121121222122.content:
The kitten's stomach rumbled. Food was first priority. The Siamese had stopped causing a ruckus, meaning the calico could eat again. She took a look at the bottom of the enormous pile in front of her where the rats stood and suddenly noticed that one of the rats had plumped up quite a bit. She picked up the watermelon-sized rat as he screamed. The kitten grinned. "What did I say you have to do if you want to live?"
"T-too keep bringing you food?" he stammered.
"Exactly. And when I say that, it means you give me ALL of the food. It doesn't mean you can have some." She licked her lips. "But you had some food anyway. But fear not. You can still fulfill your promise in a different way." She then threw the flailing rat into her titanic stomach. The female rat watched in fear as the kitten turned to her. "As for you, thanks to him, you have to work two times harder to avoid punishment. Go get me some food!"
"Yes miss," the rat squeaked as she ran off to get more food. Content, the calico turned to the pile of food, which was larger than her. She tore through the food, shoving the fatty goodness into her waiting maw. She burped twenty minutes later as she finished off the pile. She looked at her stomach and admired its sheer size. As large as a mansion, her stomach constantly wobbled even when she was still. Putting an ear to her stomach, she smiled at the sloshing sound of her stomach digesting as it turned the food into more squishy fat for her gargantuan body. Lifting her head, the behemoth-bellied kitten took a step and smiled when she heard the ground shake as it struggled to hold her weight. She rolled over to the next pile the rat had made, her stomach jiggling furiously as she did. The pile was almost as large as the previous one. She smiled and began to gorge.
Meanwhile, Templeton was watching this spectacle from a nearby table. He was still quite hungry, but he refrained from eating the piece of cheese in his hand. Tempting as it was, before her gorge, Templeton saw the kitten look right where he was with an evil eye, as if daring him to eat the cheese. He wasn't sure how she would be able to eat him from that distance, but something told him that she could really do anything she wanted. Then again, he wasn't sure if he would ever be able to eat again, so this may be his only chance. Looking at her monstrous stomach, he shuddered as he realized that this time, there was no Siamese cat to help him out if he got stuck in there again. It reminded him of his fate if he was eaten again. Would eating the simple piece of cheese really cause his doom though?
13322121121222122.title: Was too focus on finding more food.

choices: Templeton goes to Wilbur and Charlotte.
Templeton tries to think of what to do.
133221211212221221.content:
Templeton was starving himself long enough. Not only that, there was barely any food left on the fair grounds. So he took a chance and ate the cheese. He feared that the cat saw him, but he was lucky she didn't. She was actually looking at something else. Templeton was safe.

"*phew* I'm okay. I'm okay. I'm okay." Templeton said quietly to himself. "It wasn't much, but it's better than letting the cat get her way."

Templeton stare from a far, being sure not to be seen as the pile that the calico was eating from began to quickly deplete. She was really in bliss. The pile just the other was gone into her behemoth belly. The next pipe she was given was....surprisingly small. Like her original size small. This ticked her off.

"Hey! Why is this pile so small?" The cat yelled.
"Th..th...this is all I could find left." The rat said scared. "Everything else is already in your stomach."

The cat then realized that she has gained quite a lot for one night's run.

"I...supposed I have eaten quite a lot. That and the sun is coming up soon." The cat said before gulping down the pile in one second. "Well, job well done."
"So...can I go now?" The rat asked.
"Sure." The calico said with that evil grin. She then grabbed the rat. "In my belly."
"Wa....wait. Please?" The rat pleaded.

The cat was about to eat the rat, but then she loudly spoke out.

"WHAT ABOUT TONIGHT?" The rat shouted.

The calico admittedly stopped to hear her out.

"What do you mean tonight?" The cat asked.
"Sure all the food is gone now, but today is the last day of the fair." The rat said. "If you were able to eat so much now, think about the feast you can have at nightfall. You may be able to eat even more than ever."

The thought of having another feast like this night's gave the cat eternal bliss.

"You will just have to wait til night fall." The rat said. "You don't want to get seen by humans, do you?"

It's true. A cat her size would cause alarm. That and a hungerbounded kitten that would eat anything might get the army involved. Even she couldn't take on military forces and nuclear bombs. The calico knew that she had to stay hidden. For now at least.

"Very well. I will go for now and come back at night." The calico said. "I've been up all night anyway. Even I need sleep. It will also give me time to digest everything. Heehee. I can just feel the mounds of fat now. You little rat will get to live another day."
"Thank...you." The rat said greatful to live another day.
"For now, stay with me. And no funny business." The cat said. "Don't try to be like that other rat who ran off.

The gargantuan cat rolled away and the rat followed. They left the fair and Templeton came out. He was safe.

"So, she left the fair and will be back tonight. I'm safe.....for now at least." Templeton said himself.

How do you stop a cat with an endless hunger and the size of a mansion. Even he didn't know what to do. Morning came and the fair was filled with people setting up thing. Unaware about the events of last night. Other than the fact there was lesser trash. If not any. On that morning.....
133221211212221221.title: Eat up! She'll never know!

choices: Why should I when I can stay here?
1332212112122212211.content:
Templeton decided he had enough. He needed to go back to Wilbur and Charlotte. He couldn't believe he actually missed them. He sprinted back to the pigpens, where he saw Charlotte with a big sack next to her and Wilbur eating his breakfast. "Wilbur!" he cried. "Charlotte! Oh, am I glad to see you!"
Wilbur looked up. "I'm surprised you actually came back. What ever happened to your 'gorging of a lifetime'?"
"I couldn't eat!" said Templeton. "I was gorging on good, but then there was this chubby calico kitten, and I was going to be eaten by her, but then we made a deal for me to get her food, and I did, and then she ate another mouse right in front of me, and then later she ate me, then another obese cat, then I got out of her stomach thanks to the cat inside the stomach, and then I ran away, and now the cat is even bigger than a mansion!"
Charlotte let out a weak laugh. "Are you sure this wasn't all a dream?"
"Of course not!" he yelled. "I've been awake all night!"
"I dunno Templeton," replied Wilbur. "Seems to me like you're seeing things. Maybe you should sleep." Templeton was about to make a snappy comeback, but then realized that the word sleep sounded really nice to him. He yawned. "I-I guess." He crawled underneath a pile of hay and fell asleep.
It was late afternoon when Templeton awoke. He stretched as the moon illuminated the fairgrounds. He looked and saw the fair closing down. The last few remaining people were shuffling out. Next to him, he saw a green crate being packed away with Wilbur in it. Wilbur looked over. "Aren't you getting in?" he asked. "Come on!"
1332212112122212211.title: Templeton goes to Wilbur and Charlotte.

choices: The rat was gone. But it's okay, because you know where she is.
1332212112122212212.content:
As the sun was rising, Templeton sighed and laid down underneath a table and decided to sleep. He was tired. He gorged for a bit, ran into a calico kitten, watched her eat a mouse whole, got her food nonstop as she fattened up from the size of a turkey to the size of a mansion, got eaten by her, got out of her stomach thanks to a Siamese cat, and ran away, all in just one night. This rat needed to rest. He closed his eyes and immediately fell asleep.
The sun was now completely up. The setup crew were unaware of the fact that absolutely nothing edible was left on the fairgrounds. They just set up their props like it was another day. And it was the last day too. There would be three times the normal amount of people today, as the pig-judging contest would be today. Plus, they gave discounts on the last day, so they weren't surprised when they finished their setup and already found a huge line waiting to buy tickets for the entry, the people completely oblivious to the huge white mass behind them, slowly rolling to the forest.
Given that the trees were slightly taller than her, the kitten figured she would be able to hide decently enough in them. She glanced back at the fair and grinned. There were a lot more people than there were yesterday. That would mean more food would be consumed, meaning more food would be brought in, meaning more for her to gorge on tonight! She looked at her belly, which was already larger than a mansion. The mere thought of it doubling, even tripling in size made her sigh in bliss. She couldn't wait for the night to come! Returning her gaze to the forest, she double-checked to make sure the rat was still following her. Trying to look behind her, all she could see was her enormous belly from all sides. Grabbing down, she felt something and picked it up. It was a chubby weasel. Without a second thought, she threw him into her mouth. She reached down again and managed to grab the rat, who let out a little squeak. "Sorry," the kitten said. "I just can't see too well if you're near me, so I'll have to hold you, if that's okay." The rat nodded vigorously. She was willing to do anything as long as she could live. The kitten continued to roll over to the mass of trees, clutching the rat in her paw. Rolling into the forest, she found a little pathway made by the trees barely large enough for her to get through without knocking over any trees. Going along it, she came to a little open area about 30 seconds later. She realized that she was in the yard of a mansion. The property was gorgeous. A beautiful fountain stood in the middle of the lawn, the gray stone's intricate design captivating the kitten's attention. "Must be some really rich people that live here," she thought. "Maybe they'll have lots of food." Licking her lips, she turned her head to look at the white mansion. A yellow "For Sale" sign was slapped onto the door. Nobody owned this house yet. "What a shame," the calico thought. "Of all the houses I could have come across, I come across one that's not even sold yet? Why?" In frustration, she rolled over the property. The fountain was smashed into little bits of stone floating in some water. Dust, rubble, and wood were all of what remained of the mansion. She smiled. To think that just her stomach had caused all of that destruction! Suddenly, her stomach growled again, as it always did. She turned to the rat. "Okay, now that we're here, I'm going to nap. As for you, I want you to gather some food for me. I'm going to sleep and I'm waking up at noon. When I wake up, I better have a big pile of food waiting for me, okay?" The rat nodded and scampered off as the cat dozed off.
An hour and a half later, the kitten opened her eyes and blinked a couple of times. She yawned and stretched her chubby limbs, which were even thicker than tree trunks. Then she looked at her body. Her face had plumped up quite a bit. A lot of fat seemed to have gone to her rump, which was now very plush and jiggly. But where almost all of the fat went was her stomach. She looked at her monstrosity of a stomach and grinned. A huge blob of pure fat was what her stomach was composed of, and she loved every corpulent inch of herself. She then took a look at the huge pile of food in front of her. It was a little more than three quarters of her size, which shocked the calico. She didn't know there was that much food nearby. Looking down at the rat, she asked her, "Where did you get all of this?"
"The nearby supermarkets," answered the rat.
The cat cocked her head. "How did you manage to get the food?"
"They were closed."
"All four of them?" asked the kitten.
"All four."
"And how many supermarkets have you emptied so far?"
"Just one, the one farthest away from here."
The calico licked her lips. "Get me the food from all of them."
"Of course." The rat scampered off to get more food for her. Truth be told, she actually didn't mind getting food for the calico at this point. It was fascinating to see a creature that was once so small reach such extreme proportions. At some point, when she took a short break, she stared at the kitten's massive stomach, trying to comprehend how she could hold so much food. She had once tried to count the rolls of fat on the calico's stomach while she was asleep, but got bored after she hit triple digits. Finding the next supermarket, she spotted a garbage bag. She took a few of them and ran into the store.
Twenty minutes later, she came bag with 5 garbage bags filled with food. The supermarket had been cleaned out thanks to her. The rat dragged them over to the spot where the kitten was. The calico was finishing off the first pile and grinned as she saw the new food coming in. "Supermarket two has been emptied," announced the rat. "The contents are right here."
"Excellent," responded the kitten, digging into the food. The rat scampered off to do this again for the other supermarket, and then for the one after that. Each time, she brought back bags filled with the food from the supermarket and went to the next one, only to come back twenty minutes later to find the previous pile polished off. As the rat brought back the final mound of food, she sat back and relaxed.
Twenty minutes later, the rat was resting in the shade when she heard a loud cracking sound. She jumped up and looked around. A couple of trees had fallen over due to the kitten's obesity. The stomach of the calico itself was the size of the entire property. She belched. "Ahh," she sighed, patting her vast stomach. "Good job," she said to the rat. "Thank you for your service."
"You're welcome," responded the rat.
A yawn came out from the kitten. "And now, time to rest again." The obese calico then closed her eyes and went back into slumber.
At nine o'clock, the calico slowly opened her eyes. The stars and moon were out. She looked at her body, which had shrunk a little during the duration of her nap. Now the size of three mansions, she still took up the entire property ground with just her stomach, though her stomach didn't touch the edges nearly as much as they did before. Her body had even more rolls of fat at this point. Her numerous chins swayed in the wind. Looking at the fair, she noticed the fairgrounds were closing down, and everyone was heading home.
The fair! The calico immediately sprang up, causing tremors in the ground. Finally! All of that napping, and she got to have round 2 with the fair. She was just about to roll over to the fair when she realized...
1332212112122212212.title: Templeton tries to think of what to do.

133221212.content:
"Of course," he muttered as he scurried away. Once he was out of sight of the cat, he ran far far away from the cat to a fresh gorging spot. He smiled and licked his lips. "Here we go."

***

The sun was rising as Templeton was finishing off his gorge. Larger than a chalndelier, he felt as if he had the gorging of a lifetime. Still, it felt as if he didn't gorge on enough to feed and army of rats. As he reached for the last morsel of food in the fair, he was beaten by a blubbery paw. Shocked, Templeton looked up as the reason for the lack of food was explained.
